article.title: Enhanced Discrete Events System framework (graph based). Requirements.

abstract.simpara: This document collects use-cases and software requirements for Discrete Events System framework ver 2.

sect2.title: UC_GRAPH_01 Getting parent nodes available.
sect2.sect3:
Description CLIENT requests adding new graph node into the graph - SYSTEM offers the following ways to do this:
From the current graphs loaded in environment by specifyinc local URI From external graph by specifying full URI (URI includes graph spec and node within the spec) From graph provider

sect2.title: UC_GRAPH_02 Creation from spec
sect2.sect3: Description CLIENT requests creation of graph by spec - SYSTEM creates the graph using the spec given.

sect2.title: UC_GRAPH_02.1 Spec of creation
sect2.sect3:
Description [Ext UC_GRAPH_02] Graph spec consists of:
Name Parent Mutations
The mutation can be as:
Adding node or edge Changing of node or edge attributes Mutating of graph element if it's representing graph itself.

sect2.title: UC_GRAPH_03 Serialization as spec
sect2.sect3: Description CLIENT requests serialization - SYSTEM serialize the graph as graph spec.

sect2.title: UC_GRAHP_04 Providing ifaces
sect2.sect3: Description CLIENT requests element for some interface - SYSTEM ensures elements providing interface or indicates that the interface cannot be provided.

itemizedlist.listitem: The corporative approach is to be used, so element can provide not only "it's owned" interface but also interface provided by elements that "cooperate" to it.
The policy of providing interface in cooperative network is to be defined

sect2.title: UC_CONN_03 Connection
sect2.sect3: Description CLIENT requests connecting two systems - SYSTEM allows connecting systems so one system gets able to communicate to another.

itemizedlist.listitem: System contains end points for connection. Connection is established via creating relation between end points of two systems. Such connection endpoints are called Connection points (CP).

sect2.title: UC_CONN_04 Extention
sect2.sect3: Description CLIENT requests to exhibit iface of some internal component of the system - SYSTEM provides this via having CP that on one hand serves as end point for connection from external system but on the oner hand is connected to internal component. Such connection point is called Extention Point (EP).

sect2.title: UC_CONN_01 CPs providing interfaces
sect2.sect3: Description CLIENT requests CP for some interface - CP provides only interface that is specified as provided.

itemizedlist.listitem: There is no possibility for CLIENT to obtains some other interface of system via the CP.
Is this constraint really needed? In fact the connecting policies avoid connecing incompatible CP. The only problem can be access through C interface.

sect2.title: UC_CONN_02 Sockets
sect2.sect3: Description CLIENT requests connection of endpoints that are more complex that single CP - SYSTEM provides the means of connecting in form of socket.

itemizedlist.listitem: Socket is element that contains other CPs
Sockets are to be compatible in order to be connected.

sect2.title: UC_CONN_05 Extention of sockets
sect2.sect3: Description CLIENT requests extending of some internal socket - SYSTEM extends the socket via proper extention point form of socket.
